What is the main advantage of using nano: Their small size, stability, and ability to bind unique epitopes inaccessible to conventional antibodies.
Their ability to be rapidly produced in large quantities using bacterial expression systems.
Their capacity to induce a strong immune response when used as a vaccine component.
Their inherent resistance to degradation by human proteases.
What method was used to identify the bin: Peptide-based ELISA and molecular docking simulations.
Cryo-electron microscopy and nuclear magnetic resonance.
What was the purpose of attaching nanobo: To enhance the potency and stability of the nanobodies.
To increase the nanobodies' solubility in aqueous solutions.
To facilitate the delivery of nanobodies across the blood-brain barrier.
To improve the specificity of nanobodies for the ACE2 receptor.
